alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Liberty; Polk (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:12PM CST until January 10 at 6:51PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Menard Creek near Rye affecting Polk, Hardin and Liberty Counties. For the Menard Creek...including Rye...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menard Creek near Rye. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins as low lying areas along the creek are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CST Sunday the stage was 21.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CST Sunday was 23.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 11.0 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.8 feet on 06/18/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Menard Creek Rye 20.0 21.8 Sun 7 pm CST 18.4 14.5 12.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 815 AM CST.
